website_summaries.verdict: Placing your trust in inferior USB hubs risks your data, devices, time, and money, so if you have plenty of USB-powered devices, it’s well-worth investing in the premium LYFNLOVE USB hub.
pros: Features 7 USB ports and 1 charger port
Long USB and power adapter cables
Supports a power switch for each USB port
Compatible with Mac, Windows, and Chrome
cons: If you want to use more than 3 ports at once, you need to plug this USB splitter into a power source

customer_reviews.title: UPDATE: Port lights bleed to other ports. Press and hold button a second of two to shut off a port.
customer_reviews.text: UPDATED REVIEW: STOPPED WORKING AFTER LESS THAN 9 MONTHS. Ordered another because I like that fact that ports can be turned off. Hoping for the best. Power supply is working tried different USB 3.0 cards... nothing. One slot stopped working, then it wouldn't fire up 3.0 WD Passport extn drive... then nothing worked except the pass-through for changing cell phone. Disappointed but taking a chance on another. :-(
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointed in product quality and lack of usability
customer_reviews.text: I'd rate it ZERO if I could. Did not work straight out of the box. There were instructions and then more instructions "in case those don't work." And the second set of instructions were very crudely put together. I ended up returning it and buying a different one from Amazon (j5Create) and it worked like a champ without even having to read any instructions.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't work 95% of the time!
customer_reviews.text: Have owned this product for a few months now and have yet to be able to get it to work properly. 95% of the time, anything plugged into it, whether it be USB 2.0 or 3.0, isn't recognized. Rendering this product pointless. My microphone, webcam, drawing tablet (wacom), USB drives, all are not recognized when plugging them in. Find a better product. Don't waste your money.
customer_reviews.author: Will

customer_reviews.title: None of my USB devices Work
customer_reviews.text: Using Windows 10 on a Dell XPS. I plugged this into my USB-C to USB 3.0 adapter (no USB-3 ports on this laptop). It appears the laptop recognized the hub, but none of the USB devices (simple stuff like a mouse, only one device) worked/were recognized. I tried various reboots, and even saw a similar "Question" posted that the seller responded to by saying something to the effect of "try not using the AC Adapter because you don't need it". And then other rocket scientist user responses like "press the power button next to the USB port you're using". Um. Thanks. I'm back to using my 5yr old 4 port hub with zero issues (other than I want more ports!)
customer_reviews.author: rivergoddess

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product.  Super customer service.
customer_reviews.text: Good idea. Bought it because it was "powered". The customer service associated with my purchase was superb. The seller is an example of a fine seller. The product works perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Richard B. Rosecky

customer_reviews.title: This Thing Is Cute But Is A Piece Of Junk
customer_reviews.text: Just got this just a few days ago.. Failed on day 2.. First it made my external DVD drive go squirrely and act schizophrenic now it won't recognize any of my external drives or usb devces at all... The little lights and push buttons work just fine, but that's all that works.. All of my drives and devices work perfectly when plugged into a main port on either one of two other computers that I own...
customer_reviews.author: Hank

customer_reviews.title: Overpowering LEDs make this a regret
customer_reviews.text: I regret getting this product a lot, they went extremely overboard on the LED's. Those USB slots that are blue? Each of those puts out a ton of light. Combined it's like a giant blue night light. To get the lights off you have to unplug the whole unit. Functionally it's fine, but if you have any plans on using it in a room someone might sleep, get another unit, this one is insane.
customer_reviews.author: Matt Minix

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointed ☹️
customer_reviews.text: I was so excited to upgrade from 4 ports to 7 but much to my dismay, every time I turned on my laptop I had to reseat each usb cable to get them to be recognized. Today however as I was unplugging and replugging I heard a quiet beep which caused me to quickly unplug the whole hub. Too late! It caused my new Seagate backup drive to become “unassigned and unknown”! I’m now running a recovery tool hoping I didn’t just lose 400gb of backup and packing up the hub to be returned. Not a happy camper at the moment.
customer_reviews.author: AudreyLynnn

customer_reviews.title: I do not like leaving negative reviews
customer_reviews.text: I'm sorry to write this, I do not like leaving negative reviews. The hub just plain stopped working. I took it to my tech guy, who did not give me a positive assessment. I've only had it about 3 months. So I ordered a different one.
customer_reviews.author: RD

customer_reviews.title: Very useful USB Hub.
customer_reviews.text: This hub is much better than my prior 4 port hub with a very short cord. The cord from this hub is long enough that is useful. The suction cups hold it to the table top. I plug in to it and now have access to printer, scanner, hard drive, keyboard and mouse. Makes it easy to move laptop from home desk (one plug) to office. The charging feature is good since I now have products which only charge via USB. Seems odd to me but my new laptop only has 2 USB ports which seems to be the trend. This hub fixes that issue.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy  H

customer_reviews.title: DOA - only the LED lights lit up, that was it, nothing else worked
customer_reviews.text: DOA - only the LED lights lit up, that was it, nothing else worked. Of course I tested the computer's USB port, devices worked fine without the hub.
customer_reviews.author: S+S Florida

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed with the Purchase and the Vendor
customer_reviews.text: I purchased one hub 01/11/19. It looked like a great device. Failed after 3 months and unable to return. I thought I would try another 02/26/20. Yesterday all of my external hard drives stopped working. I was only using 3 usb ports out of the 7. Now I cannot return the device because it is beyond the return policy date. I will be looking for a replacement but from another company. Very disappointed with the product after attempting 2 times to get one that works. If you purchase, you run the risk that it will stop operating within 2-3 months. The device is not reliable.
customer_reviews.author: Terri

customer_reviews.title: Great for too many USB items
customer_reviews.text: I bought an off-market USB hub that had the individual on/off switches and it was junk. This one has great quality and works very well. If you are like most you have lots of USB items that need to plug in to charge or work. This one allows you to not waste power and turn on and off the USB ports you are using. This one is great, plugs securely to the case, not short circuits when plugging items in or out. Highly recommend and please stay away from cheap USB hubs.
customer_reviews.author: J. R.

customer_reviews.title: OK for USB-flash-drives, Printers & Scanners
customer_reviews.text: This 7-port hub seems to work OK for USB flash drives, printers, scanners and older low capacity hard drives. I would not use it for a modern high capacity hard drive after my experience with it: After one day of having an 8TB WD hard drive plugged into this USB-3.0 7-port hub, errors began displaying on a Win7 OS, “You need to format the disk in drive J: before you can use it.” I ran chkdsk and found multiple errors in recently written data only. That same hard drive worked perfectly in a USB-3.0 3-port hub for a year. Update: This 7-port hub just corrupted a USB flash drive; its junk.
customer_reviews.author: Erroll

customer_reviews.title: LYFNLOVE USB Hub 3.0 Splitter,7 Port USB Data Hub
customer_reviews.text: This product arrived quickly from the vendor and without damage. The hub installation was simply plug and play. I had one issue where the USB wireless connector for my mouse & keyboard were connected to a second USB port on my laptop and they stopped working when I plugged this hub in. I moved the wireless connector to this hub and it has worked fine since. I am running a 120GB USB drive (powered by the hub) and have no issues with speed. In addition, I have the wireless USB and typically will plug several thumb drives into the hub with no issues. So far, I am very happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: B

customer_reviews.title: Lots of error messages and intermittent disconnections!
customer_reviews.text: I've had this for 2 days, and I've experienced at least 8 losses of data and a few more interruptions of connections with USB devices. I connected to one of the USB 3.0 ports of my PC Mobo - a $200 Asus, all powered by a 1k Watts power supply. I've never had that problem with my smaller Anker 4 ports. The item shows incompatibilities with Device Manager, and it stopped identifying one of my HDD completely. Returned it today. Very disappointed, but then again what sort of brand is that in the first place . . .
customer_reviews.author: Veritas

customer_reviews.title: Great USB Hub
customer_reviews.text: I used to use those small USB extenders with only one or 2 extra slots and a cord that's a few inches. This is much better. It has its own place permanently on my desk. The blue light makes it easy to see even though it's behind all of my monitors and doesn't get much light from lamps, so it's easy to plug/unplug stuff. It's got a lot of ports and does what it needs to do. I have every slot being used with keyboards, mice, USB MIDI keyboard, Focusrite, etc. No problems with anything so far.
customer_reviews.author: Zach Walsh

customer_reviews.title: make sure you buy extra cable extensions to go with it. You will be glad you did.
customer_reviews.text: The USB cable that comes with it is too short. You will need to buy an extension USB 3.0 cable to make it work for you. And while you're at it, you best buy extra cables for every external device that is connected to it. Finding a suitable place on your desktop to access it easily can be tricky if you don't have enough desk space to start with. I do like the separate powered on spaces for your items. It is a shame that the item doesn't include longer cables to start with.
customer_reviews.author: Russell A. StarnerTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: The need for more USB 3 ports
customer_reviews.text: The need for more USB 3 ports led me to Amazon to see what is available. I think I looked at all choices on the Amazon website. I wasn't looking for hub with on-off switches, but after seeing the LYFNLOVE product, I thought it would be a nice feature. I really like the hub. I mounted it on the side of my desktop PC with 3M Command Strips. The transfer speed meets what is advertised (Gbps). All things considered, I think this hub is a very good value. I can highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Indy_Bill

customer_reviews.title: Must Have Product!
customer_reviews.text: With so many devices requiring computer support, be it data transfer, storage or power recharge, this is a must have product. I have three external hard drives and a USB drive permanently plugged in. I also from time to time need additional USB for additional flash drives, phone charging, dog collar charging, and many other devices that required connection. I had to purchase another one for my laptop since my laptop only has two USB drives which is totally inadequate.
customer_reviews.author: M. A. Anderson

customer_reviews.title: Very useful
customer_reviews.text: We as a family have so many items that need recharging that it is a constant battle to find places to put them while they recharge. In addition, laptops/notebooks are frequently in use while the family watches tv or reads in the family room. This USB Data Hub solved the issue. We simply plugged the Hub into an existing surge protector in the family room near most of the seating and attached it to the edge of a side table. Now everyone can recharge their electronics in one place, and we always know where they are
customer_reviews.author: Karen

customer_reviews.title: Cheap wiring
customer_reviews.text: The idea is good but the built in wire from the box to the USB is terrible - if you move the device the wire loses connection and it loses power to the unit !!! Example: if I bump or move the box in any direction, up, down, left, right, the power is cut off and you need to spend time just to find a position that makes the wire happy so you can use the device. Cleaned my desk of dust and dirt and then had to spend 15 minutes to find a happy position for the wire in order to get back the power for the other devices I use on a regular basis. Do not buy this.
customer_reviews.author: R. Vosburg

customer_reviews.title: Works beautifuly!
customer_reviews.text: This 7 port (+ 1 quick charge port), is great! The 15 year-old, 12 port hub I was using finally, completely died. I was using little 4 port spliters for years. . . Now all of my (Nerd-add-ons) plug into 1 hub, No more 4 port splitters! (I had 3 of them...), clogging my desk. My 13 year old son has claimed the fast-charge port for himself. Now he can quick-charge his tablet and cell phone before his life-force expires. . .(HaHa.) This product is so much better then what I had before. Next time I won't wait so long to up-grade. I will get this again when needed! No Hesitation!
customer_reviews.author: Darryl New Freedom.

customer_reviews.title: Lasted almost a year
customer_reviews.text: This one replaced a TP-Link hub, which replaced an Anker hub. I don't abuse these things, but they aren't built to last. This one simply stopped working overnight. Even with the power supply plugged in, the ports on this hub are no longer powered. They can handle a keyboard/mouse dongle or a thumb drive, but not a serial port. I'm going to spend real money on an industrial-grade Rosewill or Netgear, and stop messing around with this consumer-grade garbage.
customer_reviews.author: Robert R. Depew

customer_reviews.title: Very Functional - Excellent Value
customer_reviews.text: I use a lot of USB devices. This has 8 ports. A 9th port is included for power only (not a computer connection) - I use this for charging my phone. If I use a regular USB port, the phone is connected as a drive which causes it to not charge unless you use the Remove USB Device applet in the system tray, which I don't want to deal with. Each port has its own on/off button, and the port lights up (in blue) when it is on. I can keep my USB headphones always plugged in and simply press the on/off switch to select the headphone or computer speakers. Don't have to deal with plugging/unplugging. An excellent value!
customer_reviews.author: John Beckner

customer_reviews.title: works great and now I want to buy a larger one for even more devices
customer_reviews.text: Works great so far. I have used it so far to connect the following to my Lenovo with Windows 10: Card reader JVC camera I phone Wireless keyboard and mouse Off brand magnifying camera (cheap one) All work like they should. I should have bought a larger one, I realize now as I really like it and now there are more things I am looking to buy to use with it. If it fails later I will update. All in all I am very pleased by it.
customer_reviews.author: Vince

customer_reviews.title: Quick and Easy to Use!  A Good Product at a Great Price!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this USB hub to connect all of my external hard drives quickly and easily to my laptop, and it does this job extremely well! The on/off buttons for each connection are nice, and the blue lighting makes it easy to know which drives are powered and connected at a single glance. The only downside to the hub is the small suction cups on the bottom used to keep the hub on the desk. The suction cups are not powerful enough to cope with the pull of the USB cables connected. While not a major issue it is a downside that is more of annoyance than anything. All in all a good product at a great price.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Hamilton

customer_reviews.title: Well made, high quality, works well
customer_reviews.text: I have purchased a number of this sort of thing in the past from various sources, at a lower price but most of them did not last more than a month. This one, is the most expensive I’ve ever purchased. It’s also the highest quality one I’ve ever received, and it is working beautifully. It appears you get what you pay for! And with this device, the little switches by each of the lights actually DO SOMETHING, turning the ports on and off where on cheaper ones they appeared to be just there for looks and were without function. Take my advice: spend the extra and buy this one. It’s great, Especially with the intelligent charging port on the end.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Magill

customer_reviews.title: The USB hub is awesome!
customer_reviews.text: The USB hub is awesome! I love the ability to turn off different ports. This is very handy for me because I use multiple types of input controllers, such as flight sticks, Xbox controllers, and RC simulator controllers (including my RC transmitter). And these can sometimes interfere with each other, so just a quick press of the switch fixes the problem without having to unplug any cords. I had problems with the suction cup backing sticking to my desk, but found that if I wet the suction cups with a damp sponge they worked a lot better.
customer_reviews.author: Seahawk4ever

customer_reviews.title: The mutiporst USB is adaptable
customer_reviews.text: I had already bought two 4GB Western Digital Hard drive. Fortunately, more information the Hard Drive should have or I missed the facts that the hard drive only used USB connection so that a self-powered multi-port is needed. So for the multi-port reveals that the attached external devices are revealed on the computer's desk top the external devices I lucked out to get both the USB multi-port worked with hard-drive weather individual hard-drive with its own power supply or this new multi-port self powered hub
customer_reviews.author: Bruce Lucas

customer_reviews.title: Good but...
customer_reviews.text: Like: - Comes with Velcro Dislike: - Build quality is not so good - Light leaks from one slot to the other so you can't tell which one is on! makes this feature useless really - Sometimes its light when plugging some device even if it is off (I supposed it doesn't handle these) Update: one less star! Not only Leaks light, but electricity too! connected it to a device that has an LED and while the port is turned off, I can see the light of the LED ON!!! Poorly designed and manufactured!
customer_reviews.author: M. E.

customer_reviews.title: Looks like the start of my RAID replacement system begins.
customer_reviews.text: 4/8/2020 For my initial testing I plugged in a 2tb portable USB3 SATA, and 500gb portable SATA, and several USB2 devices, i.e., Portable 300mg ATA, a 60gb thumb and a 30 meg thumb along with a drone charger. All were recognized in Win7 disk management on an older, spare laptop and access was as I had hoped. I'll leave these run for a couple of days to iron out bugs if any occur. If I'm not back to update this information assume all is well. If things are looking good I'll install this on my shop's Win10 platform.
customer_reviews.author: Adam Capman

customer_reviews.title: Buggy
customer_reviews.text: Looks cool, but for some reason, it doesn't always recognize my external hard drives. I know there's nothing wrong with the drives because they show up when I plug them directly into my Mac. So lately, I've been using it for things other than the drives, such as card readers. No problems with those items.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: USB power to spare
customer_reviews.text: It takes away the worry about not having enough USB power. With an unpowered USB hub, you never can tell what went wrong when some peripheral device loses its connection. I've been running it for 6 weeks now without a problem. And it allowed me to move the tangle of USB wires away from the computer. It allows you to switch off power to devices you're not using.
customer_reviews.author: Martin Heinsdorf

customer_reviews.title: Quality USB Port Solution
customer_reviews.text: I have been using this USB hub for about 2 weeks and have been really happy with the performance. I build my own computers and use high quality motherboards with mulitple usb 3.5 outlets. With video gaming being a big part of the usage of this computer there are many usb accessories attached. Some USB powered products do not like long cords. This is the reason I chose a powered USB hub. So far all of my accessories are working flawlessly. Previously, my gaming headset was losing connectivity at times. Highly recommend this product and am purchasing another one.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Sullivan

customer_reviews.title: Lights are so bright you could read by them. ...
customer_reviews.text: Lights are so bright you could read by them. Not sure what the obsession is with such bright lighting. On-Off switches do not work. Power cable is short. USB cable is even shorter. Even if I had it sitting on top of my computer (desktop) I'm not sure it could reach to the USB port. I had to buy an USB 3.0 extension cable to make it work. I guess it works ok...but it's not what I paid for.
customer_reviews.author: Toten the Elder

customer_reviews.title: Died within two weeks.
customer_reviews.text: I liked the design and the power buttons. Within the first week I was having trouble with usb devices being recognized by the computer. Additionally, speed of transfer for my external drive was horrendously slow!!! Transferring at KB! Week 2 it died completely and my computer wouldn't recognize anything. When I got a new splitter, it notified that drivers were damaged. Turns out, this splitter corrupted my USB drives. Had to delete and reinstall. What a waste!
customer_reviews.author: Regan Lambert

customer_reviews.title: Causes Computer to Hang
customer_reviews.text: I added two new devices recently and when connecting through this hub Windows would hang entirely and fail to load them. Plug the devices into other USB ports and they work just fine. Additionally the blue lights on each port is very bright, which is quite inconvenient when the device is in your bedroom and is casting way to much bright blue light. Will now be looking for a suitable replacement.
customer_reviews.author: Stimeykid

customer_reviews.title: NOT DISAPPOINTED
customer_reviews.text: The product is exactly as described. It is a nice-looking piece of equipment and beautifully solved my USB congestion problem. It's worth mentioning, too, that the provided USB cord connecting the device to the computer is just over 1 metre long (about 40 inches) and that was a pleasant surprise! The device is also furnished with an adhesive Velcro strip for secure installation to most any clean, dry surface. This is one of the best Amazon purchases I have ever made.
customer_reviews.author: WayneWarmack

customer_reviews.title: Slow, gimmicky. Beware: does not fast charge no matter what it says
customer_reviews.text: Does not fast charge, even when plugging in a phone by itsell (and yes, I tried the side port) It's about 1/5th the speed of just plugging into the wall. Thought the power plug would solve this issue - it doesn't. Not happy. Just an overpriced USB port. Waiting 5 1/2 hours for a phone to charge is nonsense. Should of just bought a generic one.
customer_reviews.author: Jane

customer_reviews.title: Works Great
customer_reviews.text: For what I'm using it for it works great. I am not pushing the USB 3.0 limits with it so I can't really speak to speed issues with file transfers and the like but I have found it to be plenty fast when I plug in an external drive to transfer some files but I've not actually speed tested it. All the ports work great and with some double-sided sticky tape to keep in in one place I very pleased with it.
customer_reviews.author: Tiger88

customer_reviews.title: Great customer service!
customer_reviews.text: Update Sept 2019 Seller offered and shipped me a brand new replacement unit - for free. This is nice and unexpected The new unit works well. Old unit will go to Goodwill as someone can still make use of it. I got this on Feb 28, 2018. Fast forward one year later - one of the LEDs indicating port active went dead; few months after that - another LED went off. Besides this, the device sometimes prevents MAC mini to sleep. Overall I'd look somewhere else.
customer_reviews.author: B.O.

customer_reviews.title: Useless
customer_reviews.text: Needed an extra couple ports for new USB devices, so I bought this to replace an older splitter, which worked fine. Plugged my devices into the Lyfnlove hub; the blue LEDs light up, but none of my drives were recognized by the computer. Over the course of a week, I turned the computer off and on a few dozen times, but no evidence of any external hard drives. Finally removed the Lyfnlove hub and replaced my original hub, and all my drives are again recognized by my computer. I'd return it for a refund if it wasn't so much hassle.
customer_reviews.author: M. Cohen

customer_reviews.title: Gradually failed over a period of 4 months
customer_reviews.text: Originally this hub worked well, but gradually the first port would only work intermittently and then not at all with my hard drive. Then other ports would not work with other peripherals. I have contacted LYFNLOVE to ask them to replace under their warranty. They have asked me to do elaborate and time-consuming troubleshooting and still have not sent me a replacement hub, despite stating that they would after I did the troubleshooting.
customer_reviews.author: syzygy

customer_reviews.title: This Switch Is Great!
customer_reviews.text: This switch is really convenient to use. I have a lot of devices on my network [2 laser printers, External DVD burner, vynal converter turntable, 2 external HDDs, business card scanner, camera/microphone and now I can connect them all without having to use all my onboard USB ports. I can kill connection to the devices I'm not using and it makes a difference. FREEDOM from electronic spaghetti!
customer_reviews.author: Jim Drosdak

customer_reviews.title: it works great!
customer_reviews.text: The USB cord is a little short (not that you would normally want it to be too long) and the power charger for the laptop doesn't seem to work with my laptop, BUT wasn't really buying it for that feature (didn't even know it had an extra plug for that until I opened it up). It does allow me to use a VGA to usb video converter, and that is a HUGE plus! For the price, it works great!
customer_reviews.author: Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great buy!
customer_reviews.text: I have an Apple MacBook Air, which has no CD/DVD driver and only two USB ports. I have two external hard drives, a couple of flash drives with stuff stored on them, an external CD/DVD drive, and a wireless USB mouse. I was getting tired of having to plug and unplug things to use them. This hub has seven ports and is more than enough for my needs, even enough to plug in my iPhone and iPad when I need to connect them to iTunes on my computer. The charging port is an added bonus. I am very pleased with this item, it came at a decent price, and I am glad I bought it.
customer_reviews.author: Christine Murphy

customer_reviews.title: Does the job!
customer_reviews.text: This is my principle USB hub, it works as advertised. I've been using it a couple of months and am getting another one. Very handy to have the lights on the strip, along with on/off switches on each port because I use these constantly to turn different gear on and off, and I can tell at a glance what is getting power. There is also one power-only port on the end for charging gear that is always on. Good design if you need a powered USB hub.
customer_reviews.author: WD

customer_reviews.title: Works as advertised
customer_reviews.text: The individually switchable ports are very handy, but the push-and-hold buttons actuation seems unnecessary. Regular rocker switches would do fine. I wasn't a big fan of the short power cord, either. For any USB hub with this many ports that external power is a necessity, but the power supply cable isn't even a meter long, and I'm having to mount another outlet strip under my desk just to reach it.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: It worked fine for about a week
customer_reviews.text: It worked fine for about a week, then died. The power supply works, but no devices show up on any of my computers Too bad, I like the size.
customer_reviews.author: DaWife

customer_reviews.title: Looks and works very well
customer_reviews.text: I have a laptop with only two USB ports and several units that can access a USB port so plugging and unplugging units was becoming tedious. This unit eliminated that process and the lights look good too. I love the fact that you can turn off and on each port individually. While there may be some light bleeding over from an on port to an off port, it in no way diminishes from the quality of this bus. It is everything I had hoped for an solves my problem.
customer_reviews.author: nancy

customer_reviews.title: Initial broken; replacement works as advertised.
customer_reviews.text: See update at bottom. Broken out of the box. I plugged it into my laptop and it constantly connected and disconnected on all ports. Getting a replacement through Amazon and I'll update my review. Update: Received a replacement from Amazon and the replacement works as advertised. Dec 2018. I've currently got a wireless headphone Bluetooth transmitter, and saitek 52 pro flight controls and rudder plugged in. I have a laptop with GTX 1070 and so far no issues. I use the recharge port to charge the headphones when not in use. All in all it meets all my needs. I'll update if this changes.
customer_reviews.author: CoopOfTheDay

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working well
customer_reviews.text: After about a year I could no longer use a mouse or keyboard with this hub. About once per minute my mouse will freeze up. If you are typing it starts printing the last character typed a bunch of times. This is very annoying. I also have USB speakers hooked up to it and you can hear clicking in the background once per minute. Its like the USB hub is resetting once per minute.
customer_reviews.author: shredder

customer_reviews.title: Ease of use
customer_reviews.text: I need 5 and sometimes 6 ports. This looked good with the advantage of being able to turn off any unused port. The down side is that it takes up a lot of space. SURPRISE, not mention in the ad, they include a way of mounting it on a vertical surface. A way that is secure but not permanent. So there it is. Convenient but on a surface that is not needed for anything else. Perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Dragon

customer_reviews.title: Product and customer support are great!
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this device for a couple of months now and it's worked flawlessly. I had one small issue; the power port on the end died and would no longer charge devices. Contacted customer support who got back to me immediately and suggested some diagnostics. None of them worked :( None of their suggestions worked because it turns out the issue was completely my fault; the wall charger had come slightly unplugged. D'oh!! All in all, a solid device that works as described, with no issues other than operator error. :)
customer_reviews.author: Jeff Bob

customer_reviews.title: Awesome!
customer_reviews.text: Got this for work because the cable I use to charge my phone is plugged into my laptop. It wasn't really charging my phone and my mouse and keyboard usb was a bit too far away so they would stop working from time to time. Since I got this, I've had zero issues with my keyboard and mouse being too far away to pick up the blue tooth single annnd my phone charges ridiculously fast.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda

customer_reviews.title: Buy a different USB 3.0 hub!
customer_reviews.text: I've purchased two of these over two years. Both hubs developed problems providing reliable USB connections. I used one to connect external hard drives and the other primarily to connect other accessories like iPhone, cameras, usb wireless mouse, thumb drives, etc. Both hubs sit on my desk, don't get moved, are not continually connected and disconnected from my laptop. In other words they are in an office environment. They tout having power buttons for each USB port. That's great if they worked. After about six months, both hubs started having issues where the power buttons did not work, and the USB port did not deliver power. Save yourself some headaches, get a different brand and style of hub.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Raynes

customer_reviews.title: Quality product
customer_reviews.text: This seems like a well-designed and durable USB 3.0 hub. I like the number of inputs, and the fact that the connections are on top of the hub is a real plus, as the whole thing fits on my desk nicely without creating a nest of wires. I also think the placement of the power switches is perfect. Tip: If you're mostly going to leave USB devices plugged into the hub, I recommend using a cable tie several 10cm or so above the plugs, just to gather up the cables into a nice neat bundle. This helps minimise its footprint. Highly recommended!
